node.name: Great Plains Ruderal Woodlands
description: Vegetation dominated by ruderal vegetation (nonnative invasive or weedy native vegetation that
invades natural stands or vegetation that dominates on formerly cleared and/or planted sites but
which has been allowed to succeed more-or-less spontaneously). Tree composition dominated by
ruderal native or exotic species (>= 80% RIV) (see Appendix B â€“ needs to be refined for this Division)
